result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven A. Colby was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Steven A. Colby was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Steven A. Colby was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Defendant is to complete any Mental Health Treatment and counseling as currently ordered and take all medications as prescribed. 
Defendant is to contact the Mental Health Agency in the county in which he resides.

records.addlTxt: 1:18 pm cases called-14CF1, 14TR43, 14TR44, & 14TR45. Defendant Steven A. Colby in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over status of case and questions counsel regarding competency report. Statement by DA Blader regarding competency exam. Agreement stated on the record by DA Blader. Attorney Wallace states the defendant would like to withdraw the NGI plea previously entered. Court questions defendant regarding withdrawal of plea.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1, Count 3 & Count 7.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 & repeater enhancers on Count 1 & 7. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2, 5, 6, 8, 14TR43, 14TR44, & 14TR45. Statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Count 1-38 months WSP to be served as 14 mo IC and 24 month ES. Credit for 427 days served.  CONDITIONS OF ES: Complete Mental Health counseling and treatment and take all medications as prescribed. Maintain absolute sobriety. No Bars. Defendant is not to possess or ingest any impairing substances without a valid prescription. AODA and follow through, Counseling and treatment recommended by Agent. Defendant must contact the Mental Health Agency in the county which he resides. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan up to 25% of earnings. COUNT 3: 100 days WCJ with Good Time Credit, Credit for 75 days served. $1694.00 w/in 60 days or payment plan. 27 mo DL revocation, 27 mo IID, OWI Assessment. COUNT 7: 186 days WCJ with Good Time Credit. Credit for 140 days served. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John H. Wallace in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Wallace, requests matter be set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on February 17, 2015 at 02:10 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney John H. Wallace in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions counsel regarding matters. Attorney Wallace requests additional status.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 02:10 pm.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 15, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Case called @ 10:17 a.m. Defendant Steven A. Colby in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was previously found not competent and ordered to the competency restoration program which the defendant has completed. The defendant has since been found to have regained competency. DA Blader - Counsel stipulates to the doctor's report in the finding of competency restoration. Atty Wallace stipulates to the findings of the report and that the defendant has been found competent to proceed. The court finds that the defendant no longer contests his competency to proceed and has regained his competence through the competency restoration program. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Amended complaint stated. Receipt admitted - reading waived. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Plea: NG & NG by reason of mental disease or defect. Defendant has a pending case in Milwaukee Co. which is at the same point in their proceedings. The court orders a 971.16 evaluation and directs that the examining medical professional be provided with courtesy copies of the previous 971.14 reports in this matter. The court reinstates the $5000 cash bond previously ordered.  Status conference scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Competency hearing on November 18, 2014 at 10:15 am.

Case Called @ 11:40 AM: Defendant Steven A. Colby in court, appearing via video from MMHI, with attorney John H. Wallace, appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reports rec'd indicate that competency has been restored.  Per DA:  8/18/14 reports have been reviewed by counsel and agree to stipulate to terms of 8/18/14 report.  Per Atty Wallace:  Report has been reviewed with the Defendant, no objection to findings of report.  Def states he will want to challenge report findings and requests to see another doctor.  Atty Wallace confers with his client to confirm he understands findings of report received.  Based upon challenge offered by the Defendant, 2nd evaluation will be requested by Atty Wallace.  Per DA:  Doctor was relieved from this hearing today due to anticipated Stipulation as to findings.  Def agrees he disagrees with the current report findings and advises counsel of same.  Appointment of a subsequent evaluator as per statute is discretionary.  Court declines to appoint 2nd psychiatrist or psychologist and finds it appropriate to contemplate the body of information included in reports.  Court construes Def's position of a denial of his competency placing burden on the State by clear and convincing evidence.  Good cause exists for extending this hearing to and until next hearing date.  Counsel had confirmed stipulation prior to this hearing today.  No 2nd evaluation ordered.  Further Competency Hearing scheduled.  Competency hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
Competency hearing on September 17, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Case Called @ 4:12 PM: Attorney John H. Wallace in court, appearing via telephone due to being held up in Court up in Wausau. Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In spite of arrangements made previously with MMHI, the Court was not able to connect with the facility either.  The Court:  Finds it appropriate to extend the competency hearing in light of logistical challenges that exist today.  Competency Hrg continued to and until 9/17/14.  Competency hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Competency hearing on September 5, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

Case called @ 2:35 p.m. Defendant Steven A. Colby in court with attorney John H Wallace. Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 971.14 Competency Evaluation has been filed and all parties have received a copy. Statement by DA Blader - the report states that the defendant is not competent at this time but is likely to regain competency with rehabilitative measures. Statement by Atty Wallace. The court accepts the report that was provided. The court finds that the DE is not competent to proceed at this time and with treatment is likely to regain competency.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Case Called @11:12 AM: Defendant Steven A. Colby in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has reviewed Competency Report received.  Per Atty Wallace:  States findings of report for the record - Def not competent to proceed at this time.  The Court:  Receives for substantive value the doctor's report.  Finds that Defendant is not currently competent and that it has been established clearly and convincingly.   Defendant is likely to regain competency within the statutory period of 1 year.  Treatment to be coordinated within the Department with the appropriate treatment regimen.  Treatment to commence at the level for an inpatient secured mental health facility with treatment subject to the direction of the Department.  Due to incompetency, Court cannot address Amended Complaint today.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
